neighborhood_overview: The North End is Boston's oldest residential neighborhood and could best be described as the "Little Italy" of Boston.  The North End is one of the most visited neighborhoods in the City of Boston and is the hub of the Italian-American community.  It’s character is woven through the neighborhoods narrow yet vibrant streets that boast some of the best restaurants and old world cafes the City has to offer.  And there is history too - Old North Church, Paul Revere's house, burial grounds - seemingly around every corner.  The North End is walking distance to so many attractions and is in the middle of everything that the North End is the perfect place to call home for your first trip to Boston or for the seasoned executive looking to be close to the Financial District. With dozens of eateries serving homemade pasta, fresh-baked breads, cannoli and cappuccino, the North End is infused with the flavor of its rich Italian history. Colonial-era sites are located throughout the neighborhood. Th
notes: We have several listings available on Airbnb (all are owned by my large extended family and managed by me): BACK BAY: -  2 BR | 2 BA Condo (Unit #2) on Gloucester St: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/2277821 -  3 BR | 2 BA Condo (Unit #3) on Gloucester St: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/2881388 -  2 BR | 2 BA Condo (Unit #1) on Commonwealth Ave: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/9231486 -  4 BR | 2.5 BA Condo (Unit #1) on Marlborough St: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/15397125 -  1 BR | 1 BA Condo (Unit #5) on Marlborough St: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/12092499 -  1 BR | 1 BA Condo (Unit #6) on Marlborough St: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/3985462 BEACON HILL: -  4 BR | 2 BA Condo (Unit #PH) on Charles St: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/6066455 -  2 BR | 1.5 BA Condo (Unit #1) on Charles St: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/6326257 -  1 BR | 1 BA Condo (Unit #0) on Charles St:  https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/16693642 NORTH END: -  3 BR | 1.5 BA Condo (Unit #1) on Battery St: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/1
transit: -  The closest MBTA stops are both 0.4 miles away (8 min walk) at the Aquarium Subway Stop (Blue Line) and Haymarket Station (Green & Orange Line).  North Station (Green & Orange Lines) is 0.5 miles away (11 min walk). - Several public garages are located around the corner from the building:  Propark Boston Parking Garage is 1 min walk ($49 / day); Sargent’s Wharf Garage is 4 min walk ($23/day); 588 Commercial Street is 7 min walk ($28 / day); and North End Garage is 8 min walk ($34/day). -  Taxis, Uber, Hubway Bikes, and the MBTA are the easiest forms of transportation as a car is not recommended.
access: -  I have set-up a lock-box for key access directly outside of the building. -  Guests will also have access to the coin-operated laundry machine in the basement of the building. -  Guests will be able to store bags in the basement of another building one block away if arriving before check-in or after check-out.
interaction: - My wife, young son, and I live in Back Bay and I am available if you have any questions, issues, or require any kind of assistance.  Guests will have as much or as little interaction with me as they wish – with key access set-up through a lock box, you do not need to coordinate meeting me to get access to the condo.
house_rules: Please Note: This unit was just renovated and it comfortably accommodates six guests. - Must be 25 years or older to book and be prepared to show ID upon request after checking-in. - Please be mindful to our neighbors in the building, quiet hours after 9pm. - No Parties or Events, including bachelor or bachelorette groups.  Please note, if you are loud after quiet hours or caught having unannounced guests over, your reservation maybe terminated immediately at my discretion and you will not be refunded. - No additional guests are allowed on the premise unless they are on the itinerary or permission has been granted by Jason, the host. - No smoking in or around the property, including vape pens; no pets.  - No Locals - Do not instant book if you live within a 2 hour drive of Boston - please reach out before booking so I can make sure you have a true need to stay here. Please be considerate of our next guests who will be staying after you, if something is broken or needs fixing, please le
host_about:
I live in the Back Bay and I'm happy to accommodate any unique requests. 

My large family are / were all long-time Boston residents, and most of the members still own apartments from when they lived in downtown Boston.  All of my condo's are owned by members of my family.

Prior to my current job at an investment consulting and advisory firm, where I focus on identifying top-tier real estate managers for our clients to invest in, I worked for a small firm managing a Saudi Prince's hotel investments across North America and Europe.  We managed his interests in the Four Seasons and Fairmont management/operating companies, as well as oversaw his investments in several trophy properties, most notably, NYC's The Plaza, A Fairmont Managed Hotel; The Fairmont San Francisco; Paris' Four Seasons Hotel George V; and London's The Savoy, A Fairmont Managed Hotel.  I have taken the same approach we took at my previous firm to managing our personal real estate investments, by providing exceptional service combined with fantastic accommodations in prime locations.

If you stay with us during the summer months, we'd love to take you out on our 50-ft yacht for a complimentary afternoon sail and lunch (catered by a restaurant / bar we own) around the Boston Harbor (schedule and availability permitting).  

Also feel free to inquire about special rates on massages and one-on-one personal training sessions at businesses my father runs on Hanover St. in Boston's Quincy Market / Faneuil Hall area (Bodywaves and Fitness Together).

summary: Bright and airy, this two spacious two bedroom apartment is located in the heart of Little Italy.  The world class cuisine and authentic Boston charm will leave you dreaming of your next New England getaway.
space: Complete with ample space, in-unit washer/dryer, and upscale furnishings, this North End apartment will make for an amazing temporary home on your next trip to Boston. The open layout creates a nice environment for family and friends to congregate between meals, shopping, tours, or meetings.   The kitchen is equipped with basic cookware if the scent of pasta and pastries outside your door doesn't get the best of you.  You'll also be provided with a Keurig coffee machine and a plethora of coffee pods for all your caffeine needs. Each bedroom has a queen size bed ideal for two people.  An air mattress may also be provided upon special request. Linens, towels, and bathroom amenities will be provided.  Domio properties provide guests will all the comforts of home and the confidence of a hotel.

name: Central 2 BR in North End by Domio
summary: Located on Cooper Street in the North End of Boston, don't let the street name fool you as you will never feel cooped up here.  This charming two bedroom apartment is conveniently located steps away from many of the best things that Boston has to offer.  This is the ideal Boston getaway pad for families, friends, couples, and anyone looking for an authentic Boston experience!
space: After a long day of Duck Tours and lobster rolls, this two bedroom apartment will be the perfect place to kick up your feet and enjoy a bottle of wine with your partner or a home cooked meal with your family.  The exposed brick gives the apartment that authentic Little Italy character that will leave you feeling charmed. The kitchen features stainless steel appliances and basic cookware as we know dining out for each meal is daunting.  Though the scent of pizza, pasta, and pastries permeating the streets can be tempting, we know that sometimes a home cooked is all you need. The apartment can comfortably sleep five people as each bedroom has a queen size bed. The couch folds out into a bed as well which will comfortably sleep one person.     Linens, towels, and bathroom amenities will be provided. Domio properties provide you with the comfort of a home and confidence of a hotel.

name: Upscale 3BR/2BA in Heart of North End by Domio
summary: Located on Prince Street in Boston's Little Italy, this two story three bedroom apartment will leave you feeling absolutely charmed with it's exposed brick and quintessential essence.  Right along the Freedom trail, you will be steps from all the best that Boston has to offer including world class restaurants, shopping, and of course the rich history of New England.
space: Though newly renovated with modern finishes and contemporary decor, this apartment has maintained it's classic New England ambiance. The living room features exposed brick, a comfortable sofa convertible into a bed, and a flat screen smart TV for all your entertainment needs.  Cable and wifi are included in your stay so please feel free to tune into the morning news or catch up on work while you're away. The kitchen is equipped with basic cookware for a quick meal at home just in case are able to resist the aroma of brick oven pizza and warm croissants outside your door.  You'll also find a Keurig coffee machine along side a plethora of coffee pods for your morning caffeine fix or afternoon pick me up. This unit also has two full bathrooms allowing you to share bathroom time with ease.  One bathroom is upstairs, the other is downstairs. Each bedroom has a queen sized bed perfect for two people.  The first bedroom is located just through the living room and the other two are downstairs.

space: Elevated five stories above the best that Boston has to offer, unveil your home away from home with new renovations, stylish decor, and plentiful amenities. name: Historic Little Italy Condo with Modern Updates
summary: Perfect North End location in Boston's Little Italy!  Updated 1 bedroom with queen bed (and queen air mattress for living room) in downtown Boston (1 block from Old North Church) with a small kitchen and open concept living area, bedroom on separate floor for added privacy, wifi, and travel amenities. You will have the entire space to yourself. Walking distance just minutes to the Freedom Trail, Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market, TD Garden, Aquarium, Waterfront, subway stop (Haymarket) and downtown.
space: This sun-filled corner unit condo with 8 windows wrapping around the kitchen and living room overlooks Sheafe and Margaret Street in the heart of Little Italy/North End.  The bi-level unit is located on the first floor (there are 8 steps up from the sidewalk into the building and the condo is the first unit on the right).  When you enter the home, you are greeted by the open concept kitchen and living room spread out over the first floor.  The spacious bedroom is the level below down a spiral staircase with ample closet space.  The bathroom (shower stall) is on the main level next to the living room. This home has recently been updated in February 2017 with new hardwood flooring (dark stained) in the main living space and new plush carpeting in the bedroom.   The home also provides free high-speed blast wifi, air conditioning, and the television options include Comcast/Xfinity digital TV with HBO, Showtime, Cinemax and Starz.   All linens, towels and basic toiletries are provided.  The
description: Perfect North End location in Boston's Little Italy!  Updated 1 bedroom with queen bed (and queen air mattress for living room) in downtown Boston (1 block from Old North Church) with a small kitchen and open concept living area, bedroom on separate floor for added privacy, wifi, and travel amenities. You will have the entire space to yourself. Walking distance just minutes to the Freedom Trail, Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market, TD Garden, Aquarium, Waterfront, subway stop (Haymarket) and downtown. This sun-filled corner unit condo with 8 windows wrapping around the kitchen and living room overlooks Sheafe and Margaret Street in the heart of Little Italy/North End.  The bi-level unit is located on the first floor (there are 8 steps up from the sidewalk into the building and the condo is the first unit on the right).  When you enter the home, you are greeted by the open concept kitchen and living room spread out over the first floor.  The spacious bedroom is the level below down a spiral stai
neighborhood_overview: The North End is Boston's Little Italy and it is one of the most popular neighborhoods in the region, filled with both locals and tourists alike.  People come from all over to enjoy the fresh and authentic Italian food and bakeries but the scenery and history of the North End can't be beat.  You are steps from the Old North Church, from which the famous "One if by land, and two if by sea" signal is said to have been sent (Paul Revere's midnight ride).  You can access the Freedom Trail and infamous Hanover Street within a block from the condo.  Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market are only a few blocks away as well as the harbor and other historic landmarks.  The home is also very close (8 minute walk) to the TD Garden for concerts/Bruins/Celtics games.
notes: NA
transit: Boston is a walking city and by staying in the heart of the North End/Little Italy, you can walk to most of the key points in the city.  We are only a couple blocks from the Haymarket subway (called the T) stop and Uber/Lyft are extremely popular here and many times cheaper than the subway or cabs.
access: You will have access to the entire condo and won't share the space with anyone else.  You are able to use the home as your own, feel free to use the kitchen and any supplies, watch movies and enjoy the home.
interaction: I am available for anything you need but only around if you'd like to meet or need assistance.  I have a car and I'm happy to help with anything you may need in the event of a bind.  I can have the kitchen stocked or prepare any supplies you may need in advance at the home.
house_rules: - Quiet hours after 10 p.m. - No smoking on the premises - No parties and no more than 4 guests allowed to stay at one time Rental agreement - Per my insurance policy requirements, by making a reservation and ultimately booking the home, you are agreeing to the following: 1. You're responsible for ensuring that the accommodation is left in the condition it was in upon check-in. 2. You shall be liable for any damages caused by your own acts and omissions (including without limitation failure to timely vacate the accommodation) and also for the acts and omissions of any individuals that you invite or otherwise allow into the accommodation. If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to ask in your inquiry or at any time during your stay.
host_about: I live in South Boston, MA (Southie to residents) and I'm a professional in my late-thirties working and living in the city.  I love dogs, have enjoyed doing home improvements and like sharing my home with others.  Airbnb has been a great experience for me and it has allowed me to improve other areas for my home for both myself and my guests.

name: Brand New North End Luxurious One Bedroom Condo
summary: Beautiful  brand new condo in the Heart of the North End, Boston MA. Enjoy one of the nicest location in the North End in a luxurious brand new apartment and your own roof top.
space: North End, Luxury Condo apartment. We are on the 3rd floor ( no elevator) Our North End vacation home was designed to make us feel like we are staying in a 5 star luxury hotel... it will make you feel that way too.  Located in Boston's historic North End and just steps away from the Waterfront, Rose Kennedy Greenway, Freedom Trail, Paul Revere's house & the Old North Church, Boston Garden, Faneuil Hall & Haymarket and Boston Harborwalk ... in the heart of everything. Our home is hidden down a private way leading to a brick courtyard with a bubbling fountain through a passageway lit by lanterns reminiscent of the days of Paul Revere. There is no location anywhere like this in the North End. It offers a remarkably quiet & private retreat from the bustle of city – while putting you within walking distance of all that the North End has to offer. The apartment has French doors opening to hand made wrought iron Juliette balconies, solid hardwood white oak flooring, stainless steel appliances

host_about:
I love traveling and enjoying new environments and culture. I have traveled thru almost all the world (the Americas, Europe, Asia, the Middle East) My background is in Human Services and translation, So serving and working with other nationalities and languages is part of my professional and leisure life. 
I treat my guests as I would like to be treated when I get to a new place and unknown environment. I am patient, polite and respectful of people needs. 
All my guests have always left happy and grateful for the services they have receive from me and that is my best reward. They all are for me as my relatives coming to visit my home city and I love that!

description: At this Sonder, you'll love the colorful, open-concept living area with beautiful natural light, spacious bedroom with a comfortable Full-size bed, and modern fully-equipped kitchen with stainless steel appliances. Located in the North End, known as one of Boston's oldest neighborhoods, you're close to the lively Hanover Street where you'll find delicious restaurants and pastry shops, and quaint coffeehouses. The North End, also known as Little Italy, is one of Boston’s most historic districts where the Freedom Trail guides you to the heart of the neighborhood. Take a stroll through Hanover Street and Salem Street for coffee shops, boutiques, gelato parlors, and pastry shops. Don’t forget to satisfy your Italian cravings at the countless delectable Italian restaurants along the way. Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. name: BEST LOCATION 3 BR North End's Freedom Trail
summary: Located in Boston's North End, on the top floor of a six story elevator building wholly owned by host,  this unit has gorgeous city views, is on the Freedom Trail steps from Paul Revere's house, Faneuil Hall, Aquarium and Boston Harbor.  Newly renovated kitchen and bath, beautifully furnished, stocked with everything a family needs to cook in if desired.  All 3 bedrooms have amazing city views.   Award winning Italian cuisine, the signature of the North End, is steps away from your front door.
space: This unit is great for families or for one to three couples enjoying a weekend in the city.  Every bedroom has a large closet, and every bed has extra pillows.  The kitchen supplies are ample to prepare meals and there is a Keurig, with coffee and tea supplied.  The shower is 48" with a glass door and there are plenty of towels, soap, shampoo and conditioner supplied.  There are two TV's, one in the largest bedroom and a 50" in the living room.  The unit has wifi and cable, and is professionally cleaned to hotel standards after every guest.  Best of all, it is the top floor of a six story building - WITH AN ELEVATOR.

neighborhood_overview: This is a residential neighborhood bustling with great restaurants and an entertaining mix of retail.  The Freedom Trail is at your door, making it easy to walk in the steps of our Founding Fathers.  When you walk out the front door you are in North Square, the home of Paul Revere, with cobblestone streets.  Within a few blocks is the Rose Kennedy Greenway, Boston Harbor, Faneuil Hall and the Old North Church.  So much to see and do without so much as an Uber!
notes: During the Spring we will be renovating the front of the building.  This will have no impact on unit.  The entrance will still have a lockbox for keys, but workers  may be present at street level.
transit: The subway green line is three blocks away at Haymarket.  There are 2 hour visitor spaces in front of the building and close by, however, overnight parking throughout the entire North End is only for residents.  There is no parking at the building.  The closest parking lot is a few blocks away at Lewis Wharf where the 24 hour rate is $31.00.  There is also parking at Sargents Wharf and the North End Garage on Commercial Street.  You can also check out (Website hidden by Airbnb) for a complete list.
access: Guests will have access to the entire three bedroom unit.  There is a lock box on the front of the building for 24 hour access.
interaction: I am available by phone to answer any questions or meet with you if you'd prefer.
house_rules: - No roof access.  There is no roof deck or railings.  Accessing the roof will result in immediate eviction. - This is a non-smoking building and there will be absolutely no smoking of any kind in the building, in the unit, or right in front of the building. Sticking your head out the window to smoke is NOT okay. Neither is going out on the fire escape.  Violations will result in a $1,000 fine and immediate eviction, and additional penalties that may occur. This includes e-cigarettes, marijuana of all kinds, and vaporizers.

neighborhood_overview: The North End is Boston's Oldest residential neighborhood (continuously settled since 1630). The streets are narrow and filled with yummy Italian restaurants. It is known for its Italian American population and fine Italian restaurants. The Freedom Trail runs through the North End and highlights Paul Revere's House, Old North Church, Paul Revere Statue, and Burial Grounds.  The North End also has had notable residents that include: John F. Fitzgerald, politician and grandfather of President John F. Kennedy Rose Kennedy, philanthropist and mother of President John F. Kennedy Thomas Hutchinson, governor of Massachusetts Bay And infamously - Charles Ponzi, creator of the Ponzi scheme.
notes: NA
transit: Hay Market is the closest MBTA public transportation subway stop. North Station is also just a few blocks away. Grab an Uber from the Airport (or taxi) or you can take public transportation (Blue Line) to State St Stop. Uber and Lyft rides are usually very in-expensive, quick and efficient. Everywhere in Boston can be reached by foot or public transportation so we recommend not having a car.  But if you do there are some good options for parking: Parking is available at meters in 2 hour increments ($4.00 for 2 hours).  Meters are operational from 8 AM - 8 PM Monday - Saturday.  After 8 PM it's free to park overnight at a meter.  All of Sunday is free to park at meters. There is also visitor parking (coveted) on Hanover Street you can get lucky, just make sure and read the signs.  There is also a few visitor parking spots on Parmenter Street (coveted also). There are paid garages nearby $25 -$45 bucks.  I would suggest Government Center Garage (50 Sudbury St, Boston, MA (Phone number hi

neighborhood_overview: The North End is Boston's oldest residential neighborhood and could best be described as the "Little Italy" of Boston.  The North End is one of the most visited neighborhoods in the City of Boston and is the hub of the Italian-American community.  It’s character is woven through the neighborhoods narrow yet vibrant streets that boast some of the best restaurants and old world cafes the City has to offer.  And there is history too - Old North Church, Paul Revere's house, burial grounds - seemingly around every corner.  The North End is walking distance to so many attractions and is in the middle of everything that the North End is the perfect place to call home for your first trip to Boston or for the seasoned executive looking to be close to the Financial District. With dozens of eateries serving homemade pasta, fresh-baked breads, cannoli and cappuccino, the North End is infused with the flavor of its rich Italian history. Colonial-era sites are located throughout the neighborhood. Th

I’m also available if you have any issues or require any kind of assistance.  Guests will have as much or as little interaction with me as they wish – with electronic code access, you do not need to coordinate meeting me to get access to the condo.

host_about:
We have fallen in love with New England - we love the history and the variety of things to do and see.

My wife and I are originally from the West so being able to drive one hour and see Plymouth Rock, or Providence, RI has totally changed us.  We love to spend weekends exploring and adventuring with our kids.  We just returned from our biggest family trip yet - Singapore, Thailand, Cambodia, South Korea, and Vietnam for 3.5 months - it was amazing.

We would love to have you stay at our place!

name: 2 Bdrm North End Brownstone + Roofdeck!
summary: Currently only looking for guests who want to stay for the entire month of January (either flexibility on checkin/checkout before or after the month starts!) Experience Boston like a local in this classic North End brownstone in the midst of everything one of Boston's oldest neighborhoods has to offer, including: Pizzeria Regina (2 blocks away) Mike's Pastry (3 blocks) Giacamo's (4 blocks) Old North Church (2 blocks) TD Banknorth Garden (~7 blocks) Boston Public Market (~ 7 blocks)
space: This space was lovingly decorate to be both a calm oasis and cozy. Cool colors and plush furnishings cover the living room and bedrooms.  An antique vanity sits in the 2nd bedroom as a perfect spot to dress for the day.  The dining room, with sunshine orange ceiling, ornate chandelier and plush green sofa seat, is the perfect room to relax in and read the paper while slowly waking up with a cup of coffee.  If you prefer, take to the roof! The view is best served with a piping hot Pizzeria Regina or Ernesto's pie, washed down with a local beer from Hopsters at the Boston Public Market.

access: - Expansive roofdeck, with exclusive space dedicated to guests - Fully-equipped kitchen, including coffee and espresso machines - In-unit washer and dryer - Smart TV with pre-programmed Netflix
interaction: Available via text for assistance at any time throughout your stay. Otherwise, I'll stay away.
host_about:
I'm a diehard Bostonian who is excited to share the city I love with others looking to discover it for the first time (or potentially revisit)! I decided the Airbnb after enrolling in graduate school locally, and will be using the funds to help pay for my MBA.

Since I'm excited that you will be sharing my space and enjoying the neighborhood that I love so dearly, I'm happy to provide any recommendations or insider travel tips to help make your stay in Boston as enjoyable as possible.

name: Stunning 2BR/1BA in North End by Domio
summary: Chic two bedroom apartment sitting five stories above the Zakim Bridge and Boston Harbor making for breathtaking views.  Situated between the TD Garden and the best restaurants of Little Italy, right along the Freedom Trail, this stylish apartment is ideal for friends, small families, business professionals, and everyone in between.
space: The apartment, bright and airy, consists of two bedrooms, one bathroom and an open layout common area creating ultimate comfort for your party. The kitchen is stocked with basic necessities as well as a Keurig coffee machine with a variety of complimentary coffee pods. The living room provides ample seating across from a flat screen smart TV for your entertainment. Each bedroom has a queen size bed suitable for two people and an air mattress may easily be provided upon special request. Linens, towels, and bathroom amenities will be provided. Domio properties provide you with the comfort of a home and confidence of a hotel.

neighborhood_overview: Take a walk through time in Boston's historic North End. You will be steps from the Freedom Trail and Paul Revere's house. The North End, also known as Little Italy, is home to the best restaurants and bakeries in Boston. From pasta to pizza to canolis, the area is a foodie's dream come true!  Though the North End has a neighborhood feel, the entire city is truly at your fingertips. You can take a stroll to Haymarket Square, Fanuiel Hall & Quincy Market, the New England Aquarium, the Boston Common, and so much more. Want to head across town? You are just a seven minute walk from the Haymarket "T" stop!
notes: This unit is on the fifth floor of a walk up building.  The building does not have an elevator. Like what you see but it's not quite right? Please note that we have multiple listings available ranging from studios to four bedroom apartments! Feel free to check out our other listings on our Airbnb profile.
transit: Did you know you can walk the entire city of Boston in just five hours? Want to give your feet a rest? Take the "T" or download the Lyft app. Ask us for a discount code if you are a first time Lyft user!
access: In addition to full access to the apartment, our guests will receive exclusive discounts to some of the best attractions in Boston. Ride and float through the city on a Boston Duck Tour; save money on the absolute best way to see Boston. Finding Nemo at the world famous New England Aquarium comes at a discounted rate for our guests. Need restaurant recommendations? We're foodies at heart, and happy to recommend some of the top spots in the city.
interaction: We do our best to tailor each experience to our guests preferences. Want advice, suggestions, or a shoulder to lean on? We are always available and at your disposal. Need a place to stay but don't feel like chatting? That's okay too, we won't be offended.
host_about: Book your next stay with Domio: hand-selected properties designed and maintained for style and comfort. From quality linens and amenities to a fully stocked kitchen and a 24-hour concierge - our promise is to delight our guests, one interaction at a time.

name: The Historic House in the North End/Waterfront
summary: Single family home with 2000 +/- SF has 3 Bedrooms and 2 Full bathrooms in the prestigious section of the North End/Waterfront. This home is on the National Register of Historic Places and has been fully modernized while sustaining its historic charm. Features private entry, majestic views, 4 levels of living space, Free washer/dryer, decorative fireplaces, and private patio oasis w/ Viking gas grill. Easily accommodates large groups and families. Centrally located in the heart of little Italy.
space: The home was constructed in 1795, the Ozias Goodwin House. It is registered in the National Register of Historic Places. Features a grand private entry leading to the Living room with two pull out queen sofa beds, decorative fireplace with brick accents and water views to the USS Constitution. Lower level features a fully applianced kitchen with high-end Viking stainless steel appliances (Refrigerator/freezer (ice maker), Filtered Water dispenser in refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, and gas stove), custom cabinetry, granite, and decorative fireplace with brick accents. Keurig Coffee maker is offered with unlimited pods and fixings. Private walk-out patio offers viking gas grill, water, electric, and manicured gardens. Third level features two bedrooms with ample closets, built-in shelves, and water views. First bedroom has trundle twin beds. Second bedroom with queen size bed.  There is a stackable Washer/Dryer in hallway. Full bathroom has vintage-style clawfoot tub, custom tile wo

neighborhood_overview: It is an ideal location, which is walkable to the TD Garden, The Aquarium, Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market, Downtown District, Government Center, Waterfront, Seaport, Charlestown’s Navy Yard, or USS Constitution. The house is on the Freedom Trail, which is a 2.5 mile route that leads to 16 historically significant sites. The house is next to Paul Revere House, Old North Church, New England Holocaust Memorial, Faneuil Hall, and Copp’s Hill Burying Ground, just to name a few of these historic sites. Walk to the Old Town Trolley Tour stop on Commercial Street, or in front of the TD Garden. The property sits across from a city park, Copp’s Hill Terraces and Boston’s Second Burial Ground are also across the street, which are frequently visited by Boston’s Ghost and Gravestone tours.   In addition, the property is walkable to the Clough House, Hanover Street, Salem Street, Christopher Columbus Park, The Prado ( Paul Revere Mall), North Square, and the Skinny House. It is across the street from t
notes: Please be aware the home offers four levels of living space by stairs. The house is located in the upscale area of the Waterfront/North End. You will be staying within the area of high-end Boston home owners. This property is not a “cookie cut” apartment, or in an old building where other renters are staying. It is an entire private house and is truly unique.
transit: The North End has narrow, dense streets. There are no major through streets that penetrate the North End, and virtually all trips made within the neighborhood are made by walking. Commercial Street has two lanes of northbound and one lane of southbound traffic; and goes around the North End's perimeter. Hanover Street goes from downtown to the shoreline, and is the most concentrated area for tourists, parades, and festivals. The North End is accessible via mass transit, including the MBTA’s Orange and Green Lines at both Haymarket and North Station, by the Blue Line at Aquarium Station, and by multiple bus lines. It is also accessible by ferry at Rowes Wharf and Long Wharf.  Parking is mostly available by North End resident stickers, so we recommend parking at The North End Garage (Brinks Garage) site located at 600 Commercial St, which is a few blocks away.
access: The property is a single family home so guests have access to the house in a  private setting. Neighbors are on both sides of the property, so we ask all guests to be respectful of your noise and actions coming inside and outside of the property.
interaction: I am available through phone, email and/or text messages for questions, or concerns.
house_rules: 1. Be CONSIDERATE. Music must be kept at a low volume after 9PM. The neighbor has small children and will disturb them. If the music is playing, please close all windows and balcony door.  2. Must be quiet outside the house. Please remember you are staying in a neighborhood. 3. If you are bringing children, be advised that the house is not equipped with child safety cabinets, electric sockets, foam corners, etc.

neighborhood_overview: Take a walk through time in Boston's historic North End. You will be steps from the Freedom Trail and Paul Revere's house. The North End, also known as Little Italy, is home to the best restaurants and bakeries in Boston. From pasta to pizza to canolis, the area is a foodie's dream come true! Though the North End has a neighborhood feel, the entire city is truly at your fingertips. You can take a stroll to Haymarket Square, Fanuiel Hall & Quincy Market, the New England Aquarium, the Boston Common, and so much more. Want to head across town? You are just a seven minute walk from the Haymarket "T" stop!
notes: This unit is on the third floor of a walk up building.  The building does not have an elevator. Like what you see but it's not quite right? We're foodies at heart, and happy to recommend some of the top spots in the city.

Guests can use the entire space; it's a private apartment, nothing shared. ~  We hope you enjoy your stay with us and if there is anything we can do to make it more enjoyable, please do not hesitate to let us know. ~ Dror Ashuah, Owner Zoe Realty Contact information will be provided once you reserve. neighborhood_overview: Just a minute’s walk to Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market, Freedom Trail, the Aquarium and many restaurants and shops.  Laundromat across the street.
notes: No parties or events No smoking To prevent fraud, we will be requesting a copy of your ID before your reservation is confirmed. Free 24/7 luggage drop off and pick up A great benefit staying at our Zoe home away from home is that you can drop off your luggage anytime, even hours before your check in time, and store them even hours after you checked out.   Our storage is conveniently located at the same building as the key pick up as 435 Hanover Street so you can pick up your luggage when you get your keys to check in.  The code to access the storage is the same code to access your keys. Directions:  When you face the building entrance, walk a few steps to your left and then turn right and walk down Salutation Street. The first wooden door on the right is our storage.  You will note that we have a keypad on the handle.   Please also note that we have a video surveillance on that door and nothing was ever stolen; but just as a precaution do not leave valuables, money or passports in the
transit: Nearest T stop at Haymarket is a 10 min. walk. Parking:    Parking in the North End of Boston: The North End of Boston is one of Boston oldest neighborhoods - filled with cafes, restaurants, and moms and pops shops. The streets are narrow and often you will find cars double-parked while people greet each other or grab a cup of cappuccino from the now famous Mike’s pastry on Hanover St. Things to remember about parking: •	The best place to park without paying is in a visitor’s space  on Hanover Street.    Pay attention to the signs because some are from 8am-6pm and some are 12pm –6pm.  Free parking is limited usually to two hours and is often enforced. The area is very popular with tourists, so it may take time to find free parking. •	Metered parking is usually available all along Commercial Street, which runs perpendicular to Hanover Street.  Bring plenty of quarters. •	For overnight parking, I recommend parking in the Sargent’s Wharf on Commercial Street, right next to Starbucks.  Be

name: Clean, Bright and Beautiful North End Apt.
summary: Clean, Bright, Airy studio in the heart of the romantic north end.  High ceilings.  Top floor. Your weekend apartment in the heart of the north end.  Walk out the front door and there are restaurants and shops all around you.  Boston hubway station at the end of the street. This is it, this is Boston!

This is arguably the most historically significant neighborhood in Boston.  Currently Boston's little italy, the north end's roots go back to colonial times.   "one if by land, two if by sea" - The old North church
neighborhood_overview: The North End:  If you dont know, give it an internet search.     Bars and Restaurants everywhere! This is arguably the most historically significant neighborhood in Boston.  Currently Boston's little italy, the north end's roots go back to colonial times.   "one if by land, two if by sea" - The old North church is a couple of doors down the street.   Paul Revere's house is two streets over.   Though small, only 0.36 square miles (0.93 km2), the neighborhood has nearly one hundred establishments and a variety of tourist attractions.   The neighborhood residents are a mix of young professionals and italian americans.  Walking down the street you might strike up a conversation with one of the old timers.  You might hear the old language spoken here and there.  Drop into Polcari's provisions feels like a step back in time.  Restaurants range from swanky and contemporary to old timey italian red sauce gems.  Dont worry, you wont get wacked, everyone is friendly and accommodating here.  Reg
notes: I work to keep this place as clean, comfortable and as hotel like for you as possible.   A cleaner comes often.   I like to provide nice new linens towels and bedding as well as nice little travel toiletries from whole foods and such.   That said, I do live here when it isnt being rented by quests.  The closets are full of my things, the cabinets are full of my food.  I probably have a couple of beers in the fridge.  Please respect me and leave the cabinets and closets alone.  There's plenty of room in the fridge and the rest of the place for you to be very comfortable! Im sorry to say don't have an empty chest of drawers for guests.  I also don't have a coffee maker. The good news is this is the north end and there is great coffee and espresso literally everywhere!  If you are looking for a hotel-like experience, there are great ones all around Boston.  If you would like to spend a little less and stay in a nice clean, bright apartment in the heart of Boston's little Italy, this is it
transit: The haymarket T is just across the greenway (like 200 yards from the end of the street. Hubway rental bikes at the end of the street.  Parking garages everywhere.  93 north entrance right there. North station and the TD garden 1/2 mile walk.   This is the middle of Boston.
access: You have the whole place to yourself!  There is a washer and dryer on the first floor.

summary: Enjoy staying in this stylish newly renovated 2 bedroom apartment with private key-less entrance. name: Charming and cozy apartment, steps from the action
summary: Cozy 1 bedroom apartment in the historic North End. Fully equipped kitchen and well maintained for maximum comfort. This is great for weekend getaways as you are in one of the most historic centers of Boston. Conveniently located close to the Haymarket T station to get you on the public transport and right adjacent to the tunnels to get in and out of the city if you chose to drive. Can easily get to the TD Garden for a game or event or to Fenway on the green line from the Haymarket Station.
space: This is a second floor unit with tons of charm. The private room has window for natural light.  There is a fully equipped kitchen that you have access to as well and the shared living room. You can utilize the spare hangers in the closet.

neighborhood_overview: Take a walk through time in Boston's historic North End. You will be steps from the Freedom Trail and Paul Revere's house. The North End, also known as Little Italy, is home to the best restaurants and bakeries in Boston. From pasta to pizza to canolis, the area is a foodie's dream come true! Though the North End has a neighborhood feel, the entire city is truly at your fingertips. You can take a stroll to Haymarket Square, Fanuiel Hall & Quincy Market, the New England Aquarium, the Boston Common, and so much more. Want to head across town? You are just a 7 minute walk from the Haymarket "T" stop!
notes: This unit is located on the second floor of a walk up building.  There is no elevator in the building. Like what you see but it's not quite right? Please note that we have multiple listings available ranging from studios to four bedroom apartments! Feel free to check out our other listings on our Airbnb profile.

name: Old school place in Boston's Little Italy
summary: 1 bedroom apartment in Boston's historical North End Neighborhood . Plenty of sunlight in kitchen and living room. Unit located in older building so it's simple old fashion unit. If you are looking for a clean place to sleep in a great location this is perfect but if you want a unit where it's comfortable to spend a lot of time this may be too simple . Basics provided cable tv, internet , small kitchen with some essentials . Futon couch in living room  Refer to pictures they are accurate.
space: Simple old school apartment in a 100 year old brick building in Boston's Historical North end . Great location in the middle of Boston . If you are looking for a safe place to sleep , shower and explore this is for you . If you are looking for a unit that's better suited for hanging and relaxing in please refer to photos because it's very simple space so not so ideal if you want to spend a lot of time in . You have the basics . Clean safe apartment although a bit old fashion in this historical area .You are located near everything . TD garden,greenway, downtown Boston, Quincy market, Old North Church , Freedom trail ,public transportation , airport and south station are all within a 10 min ride or walking distance . Check out neighborhood description on this listing for more details .. Also if you read some of the reviews complaining about the bed mattress , We have replaced it with a new mattress . neighborhood_overview: Boston's "North End" aka “Little Italy” is a pocket-sized Italian neighborhood teaming with history and charm. Among the narrow streets, hidden alleyways and park benches you will find The Paul Revere House, Copp’s Hill and The Old North Church.  Absorbing the history and folklore of the North End cannot be done properly without coupling it with the culinary lining of the neighborhood. As home to over eighty restaurants and countless wine shops, bakeries, and Italian salumerias (a.k.a Italian delis) it is safe to say you won’t leave hungry!     As noted above there is plenty to do just in the North End but the beauty of the location you are minutes away to downtown Boston. Mostly all within walking distance and what  Isn't is very easily accessible by public transportation which is just a minute walk from the apartment . Also the neighborhood is the safest neighborhood in Boston . See photos of the neighborhood in the listing.
notes: If you read some reviews about uncomfortable mattress it has been replaced with a new sealy 9in full size mattress
transit: The North End is smack in the middle of everything . All within walking distance is the TD Garden, Fanuel Hall, Greenway, Freedom trail with The old North Church , Paul Revere's House, and more . You can walk to Downtown Boston area in minutes and other places like Fenway park and JFK library are just a quick train ride away on our transit system called the 'T' . Train station around corner from apartment . As far as location you can't beat this spot . Location is the main reason to book in the North End
access: You get your own key and have complete privacy . Will contact you day before arrival to make plans for key exchange .
interaction: Am available by phone for any questions , recommendations or guest needs if wanted and if you like privacy and don't need anything you won't even know I'm around .
host_about: I was born and raised in Boston's historical North End aka Little Italy.. I love the idea of letting guest  expierence the history and culture of the North End through the eyes of a Italian not some transplant who moved here.I live in a different unit in the same complex.I run a tour company during the summer months so I can be a bundle of information for you. My tour company is Politically  incorrect North End tours ((website hidden)) but that's a story for another time but you can see where that name came from when I called a non original  North Ender some transplant.

Located across from Boston Harbor and has some of best restaurants and pastry shops in the city. 3-20 min walk to most sites or short subway ride.
space: Inviting and modern. This oversized space is clean and stylish.  The apartment is located directly across from Boston Harbor and the famed and beautiful Harbor Walk. Quintessential Boston apartment with hardwood floors, exposed brick, granite in the kitchen and glass tiles/ shower and quartz counters in the bathroom. 4K TV, Netflix, wifi. Great for friends, couples, families and business travelers.  Quiet and centrally located in Boston Proper. In the neighborhood of Little Italy.   Stocked with luxury linens, shampoos, conditioners, creams and more for your comfort. Feather bed (alternative) and cotton duvet covers.

neighborhood_overview: The North End / Waterfront is known for its amazing restaurants and pastry cafes.  Mikes Pastry is well known by many and Modern Pastry is well known to the locals as being one of the best pastry shops around!  The North End is the oldest and I️ believe the most beautiful area of Boston. It is Boston's Little Italy. Located in the middle of the city and still has the charm of the old neighborhood.
notes: Walk to most sites and the subway is just 10 minutes to all the lines which will take you everywhere in the city! At your front, go on the Freedom Trail, visit Paul Revere’s House/Statue, The Old North Church, where they just discovered some of the oldest tombs in the basement. And go on the Harbor Walk which is just across the street! Located in the middle of the city and still has the charm of the old neighborhood.  Or go to the Theater District and catch a show. Visit Bostix in Faneuil Hall for same day half price tickets! Go shopping in Downtown, Newbury Street or the Prudential Mall now gone to a great eating experience called Eataly! For some art and culture the Museum of Fine Arts, Isabella Stewart Museum, Institute of Contemporary Art, and SOWA Galleries.
transit: The North End/ Downtown location allows for walking to most Boston sites and attractions.  Also, chose to ride the subway which is just  a 10 minute walk. Most sights are between 3 and 20 minute walk.  There is a parking lot across the way that is between $22 and $28 per 24 hours of parking.
access: You have access to the entire apartment.  Spread out and enjoy!  Laundry is common and in building.
interaction: I am available by call or text whenever needed.
house_rules: - Quiet hours after 10pm - Cleaning Fee $95 -Guests will provide a photo ID license/passport prior to check in
host_about: I love to travel, from New York City to Singapore and many places in between.  I travel with my husband, children and friends.  I have found that as I experience new cultures my own perspective on life changes.  My favorite city is Boston.  It has all the offerings of a big city with the feel of a small city with a heart.  We have culture, entertainment, shopping, restaurants galore, museums, galleries, history...

name: Comfort and style in the heart of the North End
summary: Convenience meets style and comfort in this three bedroom home in the center of the North End in downtown Boston. It is perfectly situated near the harbor and next to Italian restaurants, Mike's Pastry, Haymarket MBTA, the Freedom Trail, TD Garden, and Old North Church. Easily walkable to the rest of downtown Boston and the Seaport district.
space: This 3 bedroom apartment features stainless steel appliances and granite counter tops, and all of the cookware you would need for every day cooking. The larger bedroom has two full size beds, while the two smaller rooms have a queen and a full size bed. The couch pulls out to a queen bed as well. We have added an Ultra HD cable TV for your viewing pleasure in the living room.  Laundry is in the building right downstairs (pay per load), as well as a laundromat next door.

neighborhood_overview: Boston’s North End is, by its very nature, an organic, living, vibrant, and ever-changing urban neighborhood. Encompassing the heart of the Freedom Trail attractions, it is a major tourist destination point for history buffs. “Boston’s Little Italy” as it is sometimes called, the North End is known as a mecca for its many Italian restaurants and caffes. Old time shops have been complemented by hot, new boutiques.
notes: NA
transit: Public Transportation:  Our property is about a 5 minute walk to public subway transportation (Or the "T" as the locals call it) orange line and greenline.  This means easy access to airport (just transfer at State Street Station), Back Bay, South End, and many other destinations to explore! Parking:  We recommend SP Parking located at 2 Atlantic Ave, Boston, MA 02110.  It's a 5 minute walk from our property at 283 Hanover Street.  There are a number or garages but this one is typically most convenient and cheapest.  It's located on the corner of Atlantic and Fleet street.

space: NA
description: At this Sonder, you'll love the multi-level living space, fully-equipped kitchen, and modern decor. Located in the North End, known as Boston's "Little Italy," you're minutes from local shops and restaurants at the Harborwalk. The North End, also known as Little Italy, is one of Boston’s most historic districts where the Freedom Trail guides you to the heart of the neighborhood. Take a stroll through Hanover Street and Salem Street for coffee shops, boutiques, gelato parlors, and pastry shops. Don’t forget to satisfy your Italian cravings at the countless delectable Italian restaurants along the way. There's limited parking in the area, but there's plenty to discover within walking distance - check out your Neighborhood Guide for suggestions! Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before your stay. If you need any help, just give us a call. This Sonder is a 3rd floor walk-up with stair access only, and no elevator.

space: The master bedroom is furnished with a queen sized bed accompanied by a desk making it ideal for any traveler that has work during their stay. In the other bedroom there is a twin sized bed. name: Cozy, Modern & Central 1 bed close to waterfront.
summary: Loft like 1 bed  is a great combination of new and old. Located in one of the old parts of the city (the north end-  little Italy) & steps from the Old North Church. The apartment features newly renovated kitchen/ bathroom with rustic hardwood floors. We strive to keep this place as environmentally friendly as possible with our upkeep. Please note: to keep the space as open as possible, there is no formal eating area. Feel free to use the small side table. There 100+ restaurants in the area.
space: Small one bed that has just about everything you need located on a quiet street. We try and be environmentally friendly by: Recycling. Led lighting  We use rags to clean (except for the toilet). “Simple green” cleaner Large Britta in the fridge to reduce plastic/ glass Using pump dispensers in the shower to reduce plastic. Using environmentally friendly detergent for the bedding and towels. As noted there is no formal eating area to keep the space open. The counter was not designed to be sat at so if stools were added, it would not be comfortable and I’m sure that would be a complaint for some as well as a cramped space if a table was added. As you can see this was considered and we believe the best decision was made. In regards to checkin in early and checking out late: Checking in early- If someone is booked  the night before, it will be very difficult to turn over the space (especially if the guest from the night before is still there) to allow an early check in (you can always test

Using environmentally friendly detergent for the bedding and towels. As noted there is no formal eating area to keep the space open. The counter was not designed to be sat at so
neighborhood_overview: One of the oldest neighborhoods in the country. I think it is the last neighborhood in Boston where neighbors know each other. If your caffeine fix, head over to hanover and stop by cafe dello sport or cafe Victoria. If you want the “cannoli challenge” check out: Mike’s Modern Maria’s  Cafe paradeseo If you are looking for someplace to eat, check out Salem st and the side streets in addition to hanover... the rents are higher on hanover so you can often find comparable restaurants Feel free to ask for recommendations!
notes: Best not to bring a car. Parking is not highly available and can be costly. The apartment is central to everything.
transit: Best bet is by foot, T or Lyft/ Uber (also HIGHLY recommend checking both as Uber has changed their pricing structure, especially for their “xl” rides) . Don't have a rideshare app? Let me know and I'll give you a promo code. It costs around $25/ day to park and that assumes you don’t move your car. If you do, there is a good chance you’ll have to pay where you are going and then pay to park when you come back. Here is a link that maybe help if you must drive:  (Website hidden by Airbnb)
access: The entire apartment is yours! If you need to do laundry, there is even a washer and dryer right outside the door.
interaction: I’m easily reachable by texting through the airbnb app.
house_rules: Please turn off air conditioning upon leaving. Keys to be left in lock box after check out. To close lock box use same code and push black button down. Thank you.

neighborhood_overview: NA
notes: When booking, please tell us about yourself and what brings you to Boston. We ask that you have finished the Airbnb verification process by verifying one social media account and scanning your offline ID. Go to www.airbnb.com/verify for more info. We cannot offer space to store your bags past 11AM on your check out day or earlier than 4PM on your arrival day. We recommend using the app called StoreMe which has luggage storage all over town. Use the promo code "bnbbos" to get $3 off the first hour of your reservation. There may not be a storage solution near the property but you should be able to find them near most T stops or perhaps by your first destination! A quick note about taxes. Beginning July 1st 2019, the city of Boston will collect city and state taxes on short term rentals. We don't have the exact rate yet but it will likely be about 15% to 17.45% of your total. name: RARE1,000+ SF 2 BR ON  Freedom Trail w/ Great View
summary: Great city views from the 6th flr of this brand new 1,000+ SF.  Excellent location on the Freedom Trail in North End, next to Paul Revere's house, famous Italian restaurants and coffee shops.  Stretch out in this huge unit with spacious living room, eat in kitchen, expandable table to seat six, beautiful bedrooms with large closets and white linens.  Well appointed sunny kitchen ready for cooking or relaxing, w/skylight over island.  White linens laundered by a service & professional cleaners.
space: I own the entire six story building.  These are not individual condominium units so there is no issue with the short term rental use.  This unit is on the sixth floor with an elevator and has two bedrooms and three sofa beds in the living room:  one queen bed and two twin sofa beds.  Space is over 1,000 SF and was completely renovated in April 2018.  Next door to this unit is a 3 bd Airbnb, w/both units able to sleep a total of 14 for family reunions.

neighborhood_overview: The North End of Boston is famous for its Italian heritage, abundant restaurants and coffee shops, Paul Revere's house and the Old North Church.  There are narrow European like streets for great exploring.
notes: NA
transit: The North End is walking distance to many attractions.  The Haymarket subway stop (green line) is less than a five minute walk and the North Station train station is less than a ten minute walk.  It is best to take public transportation or Uber around the city of Boston.  There are 2 hour visitor spaces in front of the building and close by, however, overnight parking throughout the entire North End is only for residents.  There is no parking at the building.  The closest parking lot is a few blocks away at Lewis Wharf where the 24 hour rate is $31.00.  There is also parking at Sargents Wharf and the North End Garage on Commercial Street.  You can also check out (Website hidden by Airbnb) for a complete list.

interaction: I am very accessible by phone or email to answer questions or give you recommendations and assistance.
house_rules: - This is a 21 unit apartment building so we request that you are respectful of other tenants regarding late night noise. - No roof access.  There is no roof deck or railings.  Accessing the roof will result in immediate eviction. - This is a non-smoking building and there will be absolutely no smoking of any kind in the building, in the unit, or right in front of the building. Sticking your head out the window to smoke is NOT okay. Neither is going out on the fire escape.  Violations will result in a $1,000 fine and immediate eviction, and additional penalties that may occur. This includes e-cigarettes, marijuana of all kinds, and vaporizers.

name: Chic North End Loft in Boston's Little Italy
summary: Spacious studio apartment with 2 beds, 1 full bath, and an excellent location in Boston's most iconic neighborhood. For history buffs like me, you're located a short ~5-10 minutes' walk from some of the most important and most visited historical landmarks in Revolutionary America, including Faneuil Hall, the house of Paul Revere, and the Old North Church where he began his midnight ride. For the more modern guest, you will be situated next door to the TD Garden, home of top concert performers, the Celtics, and the Bruins. And if you're a barfly, you came to the right place, as you'll be situated smack in the middle of Boston's top taverns, pubs, and bars (and the site of pretty much any bar crawl worth the name in the 617). According to US News/Travel, who ranked Boston 3rd in the world for travel destinations behind only Paris and Florence: "Why Go to Boston Boston is not only a hub for baseball, brownstones and bookish collegiate types. It's also home to America's first large free mu

house_rules: Please be respectful of all spaces. In particular: - Please tell me before hand if you would like access to my instruments; they are valuable both monetarily and sentimentally - Please do not touch artwork - several pieces are from travels to other countries and mean very much to me - Please place all dishes in dishwasher before leaving; I will run the load - Please bag all trash before leaving, and leave in the kitchen - Please call me directly if there are any nonemergency concerns - Please respect locked cabinets/bureaus; if you need further storage space that can be arranged
host_about:
Hey there! I'm a young professional working in Boston. I work full time and am in grad school, but don't think I'm all work and no play! In my free time I'm an avid reader, trivia-goer, boxer, and devoted amateur player of basketball, chess, piano, and guitar (which you'll see evidence of if you stay in my lovely abode)!

Hoping to provide a welcoming space for you while you explore the big city - let me know if there's anything I can do to take your stay from "great" to "amazing".

name: TOP Floor 2 Bd w/Elevator & Views on Freedom Trail
summary: Located on the Freedom Trail in Boston's North End, on the sixth floor of an elevator building wholly owned by host.  Steps from Paul Revere's house, Faneuil Hall, Aquarium and Boston Harbor.  This unit is clean and updated with all new furniture, a galley kitchen complete with everything you need to cook a meal or just have a glass of wine.  The bathroom has a double sink, large mirror and tub/shower.   Award winning Italian cuisine, the signature of the North End, is mere steps from front door
space: This unit is great for families or for two couples enjoying a weekend in the city.  Each bedroom has a large closet, and every bed has extra pillows.  The living room has two skylights.  The kitchen supplies are ample to prepare meals and there is a Keurig, with some coffee supplied.  We have plenty of towels, soap, shampoo, conditioner, and make up wipes.  There are two TV's, one in a bedroom and a 50" in the living room.  The unit has wifi and cable, and is professionally cleaned to hotel standards after every guest.  Best of all, it is the top floor of a six story building - WITH AN ELEVATOR.

neighborhood_overview: This is a residential neighborhood bustling with great restaurants and an entertaining mix of retail.  The Freedom Trail is at your door, making it easy to walk in the steps of our Founding Fathers.  When you walk out the front door you are in North Square, the home of Paul Revere, with cobblestone streets.  Within a few blocks is the Rose Kennedy Greenway, Boston Harbor, Faneuil Hall and the Old North Church.  So much to see and do without so much as an Uber!
notes: NA
transit: The subway green line is three blocks away at Haymarket.  There are 2 hour visitor spaces in front of the building and close by, however, overnight parking throughout the entire North End is only for residents.  There is no parking at the building.  The closest parking lot is a few blocks away at Lewis Wharf where the 24 hour rate is $31.00.  There is also parking at Sargents Wharf and the North End Garage on Commercial Street.  You can also check out (Website hidden by Airbnb) for a complete list.
access: Guests will have access to the entire two bedroom unit.  There is a lock box on the front of the building for 24 hour access.
interaction: I am available by phone to answer any questions or meet with you if you'd prefer.
house_rules: - No roof access.  There is no roof deck or railings.  Accessing the roof will result in immediate eviction. - This is a non-smoking building and there will be absolutely no smoking of any kind in the building, in the unit, or right in front of the building. Sticking your head out the window to smoke is NOT okay. Neither is going out on the fire escape.  Violations will result in a $1,000 fine and immediate eviction, and additional penalties that may occur. This includes e-cigarettes, marijuana of all kinds, and vaporizers.

name: North End / Waterfront Condo
summary: One bedroom, one bath in the charming North End /Waterfront neighborhood, steps away from the Freedom Trail. My apartment is yours while I'm out of town. Please make yourself at home and let me know if I can share my expertise of Boston with you in terms of recommendations for things to do, places to see, what to eat and drink.
space: My condo is on the sixth floor, but luckily the building has an elevator. The bed is a full sized mattress. Anything appliances in the kitchen are yours to use -- stove, refridgerator, dishwasher, etc.
description: One bedroom, one bath in the charming North End /Waterfront neighborhood, steps away from the Freedom Trail. My apartment is yours while I'm out of town. Please make yourself at home and let me know if I can share my expertise of Boston with you in terms of recommendations for things to do, places to see, what to eat and drink. My condo is on the sixth floor, but luckily the building has an elevator. The bed is a full sized mattress. Anything appliances in the kitchen are yours to use -- stove, refridgerator, dishwasher, etc. Feel free to help yourself to tea, coffee, wine and any alcohol you'd like while you're here. The fridge will probably be pretty bare, so feel free to bring whatever you'd like to cook. I will more often than not be out of town when you're here, but available by phone in the case of emergency. The North End is regarded as one of the most quaint, safest neighborhoods in the city. Traditionally full of Italian Americans, the neighborhood has dozens of restaurants, f
neighborhood_overview: The North End is regarded as one of the most quaint, safest neighborhoods in the city. Traditionally full of Italian Americans, the neighborhood has dozens of restaurants, from pizza shops to swanky places to grab some of the finest pasta on this side of the Atlantic.
notes: The floors of my apartment are pretty thin, so please no late night parties, otherwise my downstairs neighbors will come a-knockin'. Normal walking around, talking, watching TV, etc has never been a problem before though.
transit: Boston is a very walkable city, but if you need to get on the T, you are within a 5-10 minute walk to the orange, green and blue lines and North Station. South Station and the red line are closer to a 15-20 minute walk. Bicycles are also available for rental nearby.
access: Feel free to help yourself to tea, coffee, wine and any alcohol you'd like while you're here. The fridge will probably be pretty bare, so feel free to bring whatever you'd like to cook.
interaction: I will more often than not be out of town when you're here, but available by phone in the case of emergency.
house_rules: - Guests are allowed, but after 10pm, please be mindful of my neighbors. The floors are the opposite of soundproof.

notes: When booking, please tell us about yourself and what brings you to Boston. We ask that you have finished the Airbnb verification process by verifying one social media account and scanning your offline ID. Go to www.airbnb.com/verify for more info. We cannot offer space to store your bags past 11AM on your check out day or earlier than 4PM on your arrival day. We recommend using the app called StoreMe which has luggage storage all over town. Use the promo code "bnbbos" to get $3 off the first hour of your reservation. There may not be a storage solution near the property but you should be able to find them near most T stops or perhaps by your first destination! A quick note about taxes. Beginning July 1st 2019, the city of Boston will collect city and state taxes on short term rentals. We don't have the exact rate yet but it will likely be about 15% to 17.45% of your total. We'll send you a payment request for collection of these taxes nearer to your arrival date. If you'd like more inf

name: Spacious 1BR in Prime Historic Boston
summary: Modern, spacious apartment in THE MOST PRIME LOCATION in Boston. Stay 1 block from top-rated restaurants (Neptune Oyster, Mike's Pastry, Giacomo's), steps from TD Garden, Faneuil Hall, Ferry Terminal to Cape Cod and Boston Harbor Islands, Charlestown (home to the historic USS Constitution + oldest bar in America), Charles River, Cambridge and Subway (Green and Orange Lines) and Train stations (North Station) and more!  Apartment is sound insulated and located on a small, quiet street.
space: Decor is modern and clean, with all the guest amenities you could need. Coffee and tea, French Press, On-demand filtered hot water, wonderful shower pressure, new bedding, toiletries and an in-building coin-operated washer and dryer just steps down the hallway.

host_about:
We have fallen in love with New England - we love the history and the variety of things to do and see.

My wife and I are originally from the West so being able to drive one hour and see Plymouth Rock, or Providence, RI has totally changed us.  We love to spend weekends exploring and adventuring with our kids.  We just returned from our biggest family trip yet - Singapore, Thailand, Cambodia, South Korea, and Vietnam for 3.5 months - it was amazing.

We would love to have you stay at our place!

name: Li’l Italy, *Harbor apartment. Spacious*
summary: On the Historic Freedom Trail.  Harbor just steps away, and the heart of the city, with in walking distance.  Brand new listing to Airbnb.   Location, Location, Location..... right in the middle of Little Italy with endless restaurants and bakeries to choose from. Beautiful apartment, with all that you could need to enjoy your stay.  1920 church building, located in  Little Italy/No. End, Hanover St.
space: We are located steps from the Main Street of Little Italy, Hanover St. Be in the heart of Boston in a 10 minute walk.  Walk the streets and be taken back in time to the days of historical events such as Paul Revere’s ride. Relax in the very large living room with 55” smart TV and cable with 300 plus channels. Fully equipped kitchen, large master King bedroom with bathroom.  Two couches in the living room can be used for extra sleeping, and a pac n play and crib mattress are available for small children.

Entire apartment, main foyer/entrance. We live in the buildin
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is called Little Italy/ No. End.  It has the distinction of being the city's oldest residential part of the city, settled in the 1630s. Walk on the streets of history, like Paul Revere, who took his famous midnight ride to the Old North Church, where the lanterns were lit, to tell the American troops, the British are coming.  These streets are also filled with amazing restaurants, Italian festivals (July/Aug.) and the beautiful harbor is steps away. We provide a list of recommended restaurants, their menus and contact info.
notes: We have 3 Airbnb spaces for booking. Please be aware of other guests, our 2 other guest rooms, located in other parts of the building.  There is one church service conducted on Sundays at 10:30am. This has not seemed to be a problem, as most of our guests are up and out touring/eating. Guests are in the building, only on Sundays, from 9:30a-2p. All other days of the week it is very quiet.  This apartment is quite private and you will be able to come and go easily on Sunday and any other day.
transit: Getting around Boston is quite easy. There is a public subway, called the T. We have several T stations within a 10 minute walk of our place.  The T, can take you to anything and everything you could want to see.  Having a car can be quite difficult. There is no public parking on the streets overnight.  The best suggestion for parking is to (Hidden by Airbnb) (Website hidden by Airbnb) and look up the T stations that have overnight parking. Cost is approx. $10 a day.  We suggest Sullivan Square or Wellington Station . Once you park your car in the lot, take the T to Haymarket or North Station. We are a 10 minute walk from there, or get an Uber/Lyft. Taxi’s can be quite challenging in Boston.
access: Entire apartment, main foyer/entrance.
interaction: We live in the building , in a separate apartment. We are available for any questions or if you need anything.  A key lock box is available for you upon arrival for you to get settled at your leisure.  We may be there when you arrive, but if not, the lock box is always available.  We can always be reached by this message board or by text.
house_rules: Please make sure to put all dirty dishes in the dishwasher and start washing before you depart.  Be considerate of TV noise, as we have 2 additional Airbnb private rooms.  Please remove the bedspread before using the master bedroom. To save on water, please hang and air dry your bath towels,  on rack provided.  Please enjoy our home as much as we do, and return it to the way you found it. Treat it with great care. Thanks!! :-)
host_about:
Dave & I have lived in Boston for 12 years and have been hosting guests for over 20 years. We have been Airbnb hosts since March of 2016. Prior to living in Boston, we worked together with Nonprofit relief agencies throughout the world. Some of those places include the  Philippines, Indonesia, Nicaragua, Pakistan, China and more. The North End makes us feel right at home as it has an international feel with so many countries represented.  We enjoy riding our Harley Davidson motorcycle, reading, time at the lake and our 7 children and 8 grandchildren.
We now pastor the church here and love our neighborhood and our beautiful city. In our line of work we meet lots of people and look forward to meeting you as well.

summary: One bedroom duplex apartment on the 2nd floor, located in the North Ends most lively stretch. Bedroom with a queen size bed and bathroom with a tub and shower are on the upper floor; kitchen and living room on the lower floor with a single sleeper sofa. name: Stylish 5 Bed Apt in Boston's North End by Domio
summary: This Boston apartment is the perfect spot for large groups as it is furnished with five beds for a max occupancy of six people. Located in the heart of Boston, this home is conveniently near many historical landmarks like Paul Revere's House and the Freedom Trail. North End is also known as Little Italy and is home to foodie favorite's Mike's Pastry, Neptune's Oyster Bar, and much more. Domio homes are stocked with quality amenities and thoughtful touches to make your stay delightful.

neighborhood_overview: Take a walk through time in Boston's historic North End. You will be steps from the Freedom Trail and Paul Revere's house. The North End, also known as Little Italy, is home to the best restaurants and bakeries in Boston. From pasta to pizza to canolis, the area is a foodie's dream come true!  Though the North End has a neighborhood feel, the entire city is truly at your fingertips. You can take a stroll to Haymarket Square, Fanuiel Hall & Quincy Market, the New England Aquarium, the Boston Common, and so much more. Want to head across town? You are just a 7 minute walk from the Haymarket "T" stop!
notes: Like what you see but it's not quite right? Please note that we have multiple listings available ranging from studios to four bedroom apartments! Please note that this apartment is on the 4th floor of the building and there is no elevator.  We are happy to assist with luggage upon request!
transit: Did you know you can walk the entire city of Boston in just 5 hours? Want to give your feet a rest? Take the "T" or download the Lyft app. Ask us for a discount code if you are a first time Lyft user!
access: In addition to full access to the apartment, our guests will receive exclusive discounts to some of the best attractions in Boston. Ride and float through the city on a Boston Duck Tour; save money on the absolute best way to see Boston. Finding Nemo at the world famous New England Aquarium comes at a discounted rate for our guests. Need restaurant recommendations? We're foodies at heart, and happy to recommend some of the top spots in the city.
interaction: We do our best to tailor each experience to our guests preferences. Want advice, suggestions, or a shoulder to lean on? We are always available and at your disposal. Need a place to stay but don't feel like chatting? That's okay too, we won't be offended.
host_about: Book your next stay with Domio: hand-selected properties designed and maintained for style and comfort. From quality linens and amenities to a fully stocked kitchen and a 24-hour concierge - our promise is to delight our guests, one interaction at a time.

neighborhood_overview: Take a walk through time in Boston's historic North End. You will be steps from the Freedom Trail and Paul Revere's house. The North End, also known as Little Italy, is home to the best restaurants and bakeries in Boston. From pasta to pizza to canolis, the area is a foodie's dream come true!  Though the North End has a neighborhood feel, the entire city is truly at your fingertips. You can take a stroll to Haymarket Square, Fanuiel Hall & Quincy Market, the New England Aquarium, the Boston Common, and so much more. Want to head across town? You are just a 7 minute walk from the Haymarket "T" stop!
notes: Like what you see but it's not quite right? Please note that we have multiple listings available ranging from studios to four bedroom apartments!
transit: Did you know you can walk the entire city of Boston in just 5 hours? Want to give your feet a rest? Take the "T" or download the Lyft app. Ask us for a discount code if you are a first time Lyft user!
access: In addition to full access to the apartment, our guests will receive exclusive discounts to some of the best attractions in Boston. Ride and float through the city on a Boston Duck Tour; save money on the absolute best way to see Boston. Finding Nemo at the world famous New England Aquarium comes at a discounted rate for our guests. Need restaurant recommendations? We're foodies at heart, and happy to recommend some of the top spots in the city.
