name: Ideally located North End 2brm with style
summary: Our well equipped modern apartment is in the heart of the historical North End, just a block away from Mike's Pastry, easy walking distance to the Financial District, TD Garden, Boston Harbor, Faneuil Hall, Aquarium, the Freedom Trail, and many more popular sites. Public bikes, trains, and water transportation are also nearby.
space: Welcome to our modern and well equipped two bedroom home on the fourth floor of a walk-up building (with a narrow stairway - typical of the North End).  One bedroom is equipped with a queen bed and the other a full size. The open living room and kitchen features a large Ulta-HD cable TV, comfy fold-out couch, stone counter tops, modern appliances, and a dining table with adjustable stools for seating.
description: Our well equipped modern apartment is in the heart of the historical North End, just a block away from Mike's Pastry, easy walking distance to the Financial District, TD Garden, Boston Harbor, Faneuil Hall, Aquarium, the Freedom Trail, and many more popular sites. Public bikes, trains, and water transportation are also nearby. Welcome to our modern and well equipped two bedroom home on the fourth floor of a walk-up building (with a narrow stairway - typical of the North End).  One bedroom is equipped with a queen bed and the other a full size. The open living room and kitchen features a large Ulta-HD cable TV, comfy fold-out couch, stone counter tops, modern appliances, and a dining table with adjustable stools for seating. Everything in the unit is yours to use. We are also happy to provide the following upon request: Pack N Play travel crib, extra bedding for our pull out sofa, and extra towels if needed. I love hosting and am more than happy to answer any and all of your questions o
neighborhood_overview: The North End is a downtown neighborhood of Boston, which combines old world Italian charm with amazing restaurants, the Boston Harbor, the Rose Kennedy Greenway, and walkability to the rest of the city.
notes: This is a 4th floor unit and there is no elevator available. Some entryway steps are present. There is no parking included, but we can recommend garages nearby (roughly $25-$35 per day) and places to look for free street parking depending on the day.
transit: We are close to Haymarket MBTA station (green and orange lines) as well as the Aquarium (blue line from airport). Uber and Lyft do a great job getting you around inexpensively here, but there are also bike rentals nearby, and parking garages if you decide to drive.
access: Everything in the unit is yours to use. We are also happy to provide the following upon request: Pack N Play travel crib, extra bedding for our pull out sofa, and extra towels if needed.
interaction: I love hosting and am more than happy to answer any and all of your questions or requests. I will do my best to make your stay enjoyable and memorable.
house_rules: - Please remove shoes inside - there is a tray for shoes in the entry closet. - No un-announced overnight guests. - Please do not use our towels for make-up removal! -Do not flush anything down the toilet unless you have eaten it first (besides toilet paper of course). No feminine products, paper towels, tissues, or anything else please. Clogs that require a plumber are at the cost of the guest. - This is a non-smoking home and there will be absolutely no smoking of any kind in the apartment, hallway, or alleyway in front of the building (it comes in through the vents and windows). Sticking your head out the window to smoke is NOT okay.  Violations will result in a $1,000 fine and immediate eviction, and additional penalties that may occur. This includes e-cigarettes, marijuana of all kinds, and vaporizers. To smoke, please go to the main street (North St) away from the building. - By renting our home, you are agreeing that you and all members of your group will adhere to the no smokin
host_about: I am Bulgarian and moved to the states 10 years ago. I love to travel and meet people from other cultures.

The North End is also across from attractions like Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market, Govt Center, Td Garden and Downtown Boston.

name: Private Room in Heart of Historic North End
summary: Cozy, private bedroom. Charming brick apartment building nestled down a no-car alley in the heart of the Historic North End in Downtown Boston. 3rd floor apartment is particularly quiet for a city apartment because of the tucked away location and no upstairs neighbors. Solid brick construction and good heaters guarantee maximum winter comfort. Room also has its own in-wall AC/fan unit.
space: Apartment features bamboo floors, granite countertops, and steel appliances. Unit is fully outfitted with dishwasher, Berkey Carbon Water Filter, Ninja Blender, electric kettle, italian coffee maker, toaster, microwave, all kitchen essentials, bed and bath linens, full-sized garment steamer, non-slip/slim-line hangers, queen-sized pull-out sleeper sofa in living room. Most important - good water pressure, bathtub, six-function hand-held shower head, and long-lasting hot water. No laundry in unit, but really nice laundromat two doors down. Bicycle parking with free air pump at the end of the ally.

neighborhood_overview: Founded in the 1630s, the Italian North End has the distinction of being Boston's oldest neighborhood. Both vibrant and picturesque, long-time Italian residents mix with Boston professionals and visitors from around the world. Within one block of apartment: local library, Italian coffee shop, butcher shop, fruit and veggie store, liquor store, sushi and fish shop, and several world-class Italian restaurants. Within three blocks: post office, yoga studio, kickboxing, Improv Asylum, CVS, Bank of America, Neptune Oyster House, several salons, out of this world Italian bakeries like Mike's and Modern Pastry, Italian groceries, sandwich shops, pizza by the slice, and the Paul Revere House.
notes: NA
transit: Public Transportation is easily available 0.2mi from Haymarket T-Station, 0.4 from Aquarium T-Station, 0.6 from North Station T and Commuter Rail.
access: NA
interaction: As this is my home, I will be available to answer any questions and make neighborhood recommendations as needed throughout your stay.
host_about:
Exploring new places is one of the great joys in life.
My favorite way to see a city is form the water. My favorite way to experience a city is on a bicycle. 
On trips, I like to wander, visit museums, see shows, and reconnect with old friends.I also enjoy trying to find good food and better drinks. 
Whether I'm traveling or at home, I usually go out to Jitterbug several nights a week. (nerd) 
I have lived abroad (England and Australia) and traveled as much as I've been able to over the last 10 years. I consider myself a seasoned traveler and not much ruffles my feathers at this point. 
As a guest I am easy going and self-sufficient. Since I moved to New Orleans, I have experienced many many types of house guests. As a result, I have become even more considerate. I live by the rule to leave things as you found them.

I leave you with a quote: "Unusual travel suggestions are dancing lessons from God" -Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

As a guest I am easy going and self-sufficient. Since I moved to New Orleans, I have experienced many many types of house guests. As a result, I have become even more considerate. I live by the rule to leave things as you found them.

I leave you with a quote: "Unusual travel suggestions are dancing lessons from God" -Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

name: North End's Waterfront Boutique on the Harbor
summary: Sea luxury at the Battery Wharf: a luxurious, boutique hotel on the pedestrian-friendly Harbor Walk. Minutes away from North End's Hanover Street by foot, the waterfront hotel features a restaurant with outside dining at the outdoor patio, a coffeeshop, a 24-hour observation deck, a water transportation pavilion with water taxi service to Logan Airport,  Exhale Spa and Fitness Center, and easy access to Boston’s bustling Financial District, Freedom Trail, Faneuil Hall Marketplace and TD Garden.
space: Each of our 150 stylishly designed guest rooms is made for comfort and luxury. Room amenities include European bedding featuring down duvets, pillows and luxurious sheets, a 42" LCD HDTV, and walk-in showers with rainforest shower heads. Wake up with fresh coffee made from our N'espresso coffee machine to start your day right. Enjoy breakfast at the Battery Wharf Grille and work out at our 24-hour complimentary fitness center or visit Exhale Spa for a cycling class, yoga, facials, or a deep massage. In warmer weathers, the real deal is having s'mores and fondue by the outdoor fire pits at the Battery Wharf Grille. Did we mention we are pet-friendly? Please be aware that valet parking is $50 per night.  Pets are welcome but there is a nightly nonrefundable pet fee of $25 per night.
description: Sea luxury at the Battery Wharf: a luxurious, boutique hotel on the pedestrian-friendly Harbor Walk. Minutes away from North End's Hanover Street by foot, the waterfront hotel features a restaurant with outside dining at the outdoor patio, a coffeeshop, a 24-hour observation deck, a water transportation pavilion with water taxi service to Logan Airport,  Exhale Spa and Fitness Center, and easy access to Boston’s bustling Financial District, Freedom Trail, Faneuil Hall Marketplace and TD Garden. Each of our 150 stylishly designed guest rooms is made for comfort and luxury. Room amenities include European bedding featuring down duvets, pillows and luxurious sheets, a 42" LCD HDTV, and walk-in showers with rainforest shower heads. Wake up with fresh coffee made from our N'espresso coffee machine to start your day right. Enjoy breakfast at the Battery Wharf Grille and work out at our 24-hour complimentary fitness center or visit Exhale Spa for a cycling class, yoga, facials, or a deep mass
neighborhood_overview: North End is such a special gem. You are surrounded by one of Boston's historic neighborhoods of family-owned Italian stores, cafes and restaurants and they are all minutes or even seconds away by foot. Step into history of the Old North Church or Paul Revere's home. Take your vote into the never-ending cannoli war: which one is better, Mike's Pastry or Modern Pastry? Or if you like to stay by the waterfront, enjoy coffee and pastries at Battery Wharf's Cafe Amalfi. Boston's North End is the place to be for your Italian food and dessert cravings with a sprinkle of European charm.
notes: NA
transit: We are close by to the Blue and Green Subway Lines - each is a quick 15 minute walk. A water taxi ride to Boston Logan Airport is about 10-15 minutes long while Faneuil Hall or TD Garden is 5 minutes away by car. Boston's one of the best cities to explore by walking and it is minutes away by foot from Hanover Street of North End.
access: NA
interaction: Our Front Desk team is at your service 24/7 at the Main Lobby for check-in and check-out. Please let us know if we may assist you on property (dial 0) with any departure needs such as water taxi or car transportation to Logan International Airport.

name: North End Gem
summary: Nestled into a quiet courtyard, this small, 2 BR, 1 bathroom flat is in the heart of the North End, Boston. Within walking distance to everything! One block from the North Church, wharf, and 5 minutes walk to the orange and green T lines, the weekend open market, and more. Surrounded by the best Italian restaurants and bakeries in the city. One of the most charming parts of the city with a feel of Europe.
space: 560 Sq. ft, bedrooms on the opposite ends of the apartment with the kitchen, bathroom and living room in the middle. There are two bedrooms,  one has a full-sized bed and the other has the option or one or two twins ( the bed converts from a single mattress to two singles flush next to each other).
description: Nestled into a quiet courtyard, this small, 2 BR, 1 bathroom flat is in the heart of the North End, Boston. Within walking distance to everything! One of the most charming parts of the city with a feel of Europe. 560 Sq. ft, bedrooms on the opposite ends of the apartment with the kitchen, bathroom and living room in the middle. There are two bedrooms,  one has a full-sized bed and the other has the option or one or two twins ( the bed converts from a single mattress to two singles flush next to each other). Guests may use the whole apartment and the washer dryer outside the door of the apartment. I will be available via email but will not be in the city. For emergencies, I have a friend nearby who can help. Italian food galore, old world charm,  on the historic Freedom Trail line. The North En
neighborhood_overview: Italian food galore, old world charm,  on the historic Freedom Trail line. The North End is one of the most colorful neighborhoods in Boston.
notes: The building was built in 1899 and is in a courtyard. Sound travels well so please be respectful of the neighbors during quiet hours.
transit: Walking distance to the aquarium, wharf, the Common, transport, TD Garden, 10-minute ride to the airport. Parking is atrocious in the North End and not recommended. If you drive, it is recommended to park at one of the last stops on the T and take it to Haymarket then walk from there. Ride shares, bikes, car shares, public transportation, and walking are the best ways to get around in this area.
access: Guests may use the whole apartment and the washer dryer outside the door of the apartment.
interaction: I will be available via email but will not be in the city. For emergencies, I have a friend nearby who can help.
host_about: I work in education and have lived and traveled to many countries. I recently moved to Boston and love walking the city and finding new gems, whether it be food, architecture, shops, or just the fashionable Bostonians.  I love dogs, yoga, and good food!

name: (E-4F) Simple North End 3 bedrooms!
summary: "The North End, Boston’s Little Italy, is a maze of narrow streets with some of the city’s oldest buildings. On the self-guided Freedom Trail, tourists pass historic sites like the 1680 Paul Revere House and the Old North Church, which played a key role at the beginning of the Revolutionary War. Italian restaurants, coffeehouses, pastry shops and old-school delis pack the area, especially on lively Hanover Street."
space: Welcome to the North End, steps outside the apartment's building door is Boston's Italian culture! This apartment has three bedrooms, each with a queen bed. The kitchen area is small but adequate to cook and eat in. There is no living room in this apartment. There is no TV, THERE IS HIGH SPEED WIFI! This is a basic apartment, perfect for 3-6 people looking to maximize their time in the city! The bathroom is split INSIDE the apartment, the shower and sink are together and the toilet with it's own area. This makes it convenient to use the toilet while your other guests may need the shower! :) Please note this is an older building. Coin operated  laundry in the basement.

description: "The North End, Boston’s Little Italy, is a maze of narrow streets with some of the city’s oldest buildings. Italian restaurants, coffeehouses, pastry shops and old-school delis pack the area, especially on lively Hanover Street." Welcome to the North End, steps outside the apartment's building door is Boston's Italian culture! This apartment has one bedroom with a queen bed and desk. The kitchen area is small but adequate! There is a pull out sofa that created the second bed! There is a TV and high speed Wifi This is a basic apartment, perfect for 2-3 people maybe 4, looking to maximize their time in the city! Please note this is an older building, no elevator, 4th floor walk up, the bathroom is small and common for the North End, little Italy area! Coin operated  laundry in the basement! Lock Box co
